title: Educational Application of Clinical Data for Pediatric Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (PARDS) Subphenotype Classification

context.prior_knowledge: Basic respiratory disease knowledge, critical care concepts, and EHR system comprehension
context.additional_context: A training course for pre-service and in-service teachers to enhance medical data interpretation skills, with machine learning-based subtype classification learning using real clinical data

learning_goals: Explain at least three classification criteria for PARDS high-inflammation/low-inflammation subtypes
Apply five key laboratory indicators for subtype discrimination in EHR data
Evaluate the clinical applicability (sensitivity 76%, specificity 87%) of a machine learning model in real-world cases
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
